author: jimmygchen
content: would it help to use the `Eth-Consensus-Version` header ?

author: jimmygchen
content: hmm just realized it's optional though

author: karalabe
content: The excessDataGas and dataGasUsed fields in the headers should be uint64, right?

author: karalabe
content: Currently the Optimism Go code uses big.Int, which doesn't make much sense

author: karalabe
content: at 76M excess data gas, the price is higher than the total ether in existence

author: karalabe
content: I mean I guess this doesn't matter much because RLP truncates the integer encoding anyway, do client's can parse it into whatever

author: karalabe
content: same for json, neither big.Int not uint64 is a fixed length type in these encodings

author: karalabe
content: But if they are in SSZ on consensus side, it's an interesting question?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<hwwang> > <hwwang>  replying to: 
 ```@testing4844_bot wrote: 
 <P√©ter Szil√°gyi (karalabe)> But if they are in SSZ on consensus side, it's an interesting question?```
 They are `uint256` in CL

author: bridge-bot
content: <hwwang> `base_fee_per_gas` is also `uint256` in CL

author: karalabe
content: gasUsed ?

author: karalabe
content: If that is uint64, then imho the 4844 fields should also be changed

author: karalabe
content: baseFeePerGas has to be uint256 because that's a wei value which can baloow up

author: karalabe
content: But the excessDataGas is just a gas counter that is very heavily capped by the protocol

author: bridge-bot
content:
<hwwang> > <hwwang>  replying to: 
 ```@testing4844_bot wrote: 
 <P√©ter Szil√°gyi (karalabe)> gasUsed ?```
 `block_number`, `gas_limit`, `gas_used`, `timestamp` are `uint64`

author: bridge-bot
content:
<hwwang> > <hwwang>  replying to: 
 ```@hwwang wrote: 
 base_fee_per_gas is also uint256 in CL```
 I git-blamed it

In EIP, it was a field `excess_blobs: uint256`, and use this field to calculate the gas. But it was changed to use `excess_data_gas` directly in this PR (https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5707). It seems the type of it has not been discussed.

Nice catch P√©ter üëç

author: hsiaowei
content: <@543900561460822016> should it be included and discussed in your EIP PR together?

author: stefanbratanov
content: yeah, managed to make it work by checking if the first field data offset is equal to 100 (4 + 96 bytes fixed signature), In that case it is `SignedBeaconBlock`. Otherwise it should be `SignedBlockContents` and handled differently. Sounds a bit hacky, but covered it with tests. üòÑ
